alert.note: Alert for Crawford (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 20 at 5:14AM EST until February 20 at 9:34PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... French Creek At Meadville affecting Crawford County. For the French Creek...including Meadville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...French Creek At Meadville. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Flooding begins along Cussewago Creek near Race Street. Floodwater begins to affect residents in west Asbury Manor Moblie Home Park and Ellsworth Park near Cussewago Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM EST Sunday the stage was 14.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:15 AM EST Sunday was 14.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 8.9 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.3 feet on 02/12/2009. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon by 315 PM EST.
